snippet: Handball devotees like to play year-round, but the rubber balls don’t bounce as well in the cold. Players in Rego Park, Queens, came up with a solution: boil the balls and play “steamball.”
abstract: Handball devotees in Rego Park, Queens like to play outdoors year-round, but the rubber balls they use do not bounce as well in winter temperatures; players came up with a solution of boiling the balls in a propane-heated pot, saying that 'steam balls,' which expand and contract off the bounce much faster, make the winter game more interesting and competitive.
lead_paragraph: Handball devotees like to play year-round, but the rubber balls don’t bounce as well in the cold. Players in Rego Park, Queens, came up with a solution: boil the balls and play “steamball.”

headline.seo: In Queens, Handball Turns to Steamball in the Cold
headline.main: In Queens, Cold Weather Brings Heat to Handball
headline.print_headline: In Queens, Cold Weather Brings Heat To Handball
